intro: Anisophyllum aegyptiacum, commonly known as Egyptian liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a small, mat-forming liverwort that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rocky crevices or along stream banks. The plant has a distinctive structure with leafy shoots that are often clustered and have a rough, textured surface. Its reproductive structures, known as sporophytes, are borne on short, stalked leaves. Anisophyllum aegyptiacum is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, showcasing its adaptability to challenging environmental conditions.
